title: Watchmaking Vocabulary
description: It's time to test your knowledge of horology and the precise language of watchmakers.

questions.question: What is 'horology'?
options: The art and science of measuring time and making timepieces
A type of fortune telling
The study of the horizon
The study of horror films

questions.question: What is a 'complication' in watchmaking?
options: A difficult repair
Any function in a watch beyond basic timekeeping, such as a calendar or chronograph
A watch that is hard to read
A defect in the watch

questions.question: What does 'escapement' refer to in a mechanical watch?
options: The watch's winding stem
The mechanism that controls the release of energy from the mainspring at regular intervals
The way to escape from a watch case
An emergency stop function

questions.question: What is a 'mainspring'?
options: The largest spring in a clock tower
A spring used to attach the strap
The spring that holds the back case on
The coiled spring that stores energy and powers a mechanical watch

questions.question: What is a 'bezel' on a watch?
options: The watch's back cover
The button used to set the time
The watch face
The ring surrounding the watch crystal, sometimes rotatable with markings for timing or other functions

questions.question: What does 'chronograph' mean?
options: A very old clock
A watch with a built-in stopwatch function for measuring elapsed time
A watch that chimes the hour
A watch that writes

questions.question: What is a 'movement' in watchmaking?
options: The motion of the second hand
Shaking the watch to wind it
Transporting watches from the factory
The internal mechanism that drives the watch and its functions

questions.question: What does 'jewels' refer to in a watch mechanism?
options: Decorative stones on the strap
Diamonds on the watch face
Synthetic rubies or sapphires used as bearings to reduce friction in the movement
The sparkle of the watch crystal

questions.question: What is a 'tourbillon'?
options: A type of watch strap
A wind-up toy clock
A French word for a clock tower
A rotating cage mechanism that counteracts the effects of gravity on a watch's accuracy

questions.question: What does 'crown' refer to on a watch?
options: The highest point of the crystal
A royal watch brand
The knob on the side of the watch used for winding and setting the time
A decorative top piece

questions.question: What is a 'subdial'?
options: A secret phone number
The underside of a watch
A dial that is below standard quality
A smaller dial set within the main watch face, often for seconds or chronograph functions

questions.question: What does 'automatic' mean for a watch?
options: A battery-powered watch
A mechanical watch that winds itself using a rotor that moves with the wearer's arm motion
A watch with automatic light-up features
It sets itself to the correct time

questions.question: What is a 'crystal' on a watch?
options: A type of decorative gem
The transparent cover over the watch face, made of glass, mineral, or sapphire
A type of watch case material
A quartz timing element

questions.question: What does 'water resistance' rated in 'ATM' mean?
options: Atmospheres, a unit of pressure indicating how much water pressure the watch can withstand
At The Maximum
Automatic Testing Method
Aquatic Timer Mode

questions.question: What is a 'lug' on a watch?
options: A decorative knob
The projections on the watch case where the strap or bracelet attaches
A heavy watch design
A magnifying feature on the crystal
